page.title: 03Leisure in Coddenham area
page.content: Many of the recreational activities enjoyed in this area take place in the Village Halls at Coddenham and Hemingstone. They include Girl Guides, a Youth Club, Women's Institutes, Over 60s Club and Keep Fit. Hire charges are reasonable. Football is played on the Coddenham recreation ground where there are also children's swings. The local cricket team plays at nearby Claydon. A Playvan and Mobile Library regularly visit the villages. Many of the local clubs are helped by yearly donations from a Trust originally set up by Lady Gardemau (1662-1757) to help needy children in the area. Coddenham Country Club (owned by its members) is popular with many families where snooker, pool and darts can be played. Horse riders are often seen. Gardening is a popular pastime and some gardens even have croquet lawns.
